DataElement.preferredName: Patient Histologically Confirmed Chemotherapy Naive Advanced Unresectable Pemetrexed-Cisplatin Regimen Recommended Solid Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating that a patient's diagnosis of advanced unresectable solid tumor for which pemetrexed/cisplatin regimen is indicated has been histologically and cytologically confirmed that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Histologically Confirmed Chemotherapy Naive Advanced Unresectable Pemetrexed-Cisplatin Regimen Recommended Solid Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Involving the use of histology or histological techniques._Having been established or verified._No prior treatment for the study disorder._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._Far along in course._Unable to be removed with surgery._A regimen consisting of pemetrexed and cisplatin used for the treatment of malignant mesothelioma._Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is._An abnormal mass of tissue that usually does not contain cysts or liquid areas. Solid tumors may be benign (not cancer), or malignant (cancer). Different types of solid tumors are named for the type of cells that form them. Examples of solid tumors are sarcomas, carcinomas, and lymphomas. Leukemias (cancers of the blood) generally do not form solid tumors._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Histologically Confirmation No Prior Therapy Chemotherapy Advanced Unresectable Pemetrexed-Cisplatin Regimen Recommendation Solid Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.:Having been established or verified.:No prior treatment for the study disorder.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:Far along in course.:Unable to be removed with surgery.:A regimen consisting of pemetrexed and cisplatin used for the treatment of malignant mesothelioma.:Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.:An abnormal mass of tissue that usually does not contain cysts or liquid areas. Solid tumors may be benign (not cancer), or malignant (cancer). Different types of solid tumors are named for the type of cells that form them. Examples of solid tumors are sarcomas, carcinomas, and lymphomas. Leukemias (cancers of the blood) generally do not form solid tumors.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.
No prior treatment for the study disorder.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
Not capable of being removed by surgery.
A regimen consisting of pemetrexed and cisplatin that may be used for the treatment of malignant peritoneal and pleural mesothelioma, and non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically proven chemotherapy-naïve advanced unresectable solid tumors for which pemetrexed combined with cisplatin is an indicated regimen (malignant mesothelioma, non-small cell lung cancer, ovarian cancer and thymoma)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Arm A Dose Level 4 (75 mg/m2 Cisplatin): Does patient have histologically proven chemotherapy-naive advanced unresectable solid tumors for which pemetrexed combined with cisplatin is an indicated regimen?
